newsitem.title: GERMANY: Puma sees record result in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Puma sees record result in 1996.

text.p: German sportwear maker Puma AG will post another record profit in 1996, chief executive Jochen Zeitz said on Wednesday.
Zeitz told Reuters by telephone from the U.S. that the result would be the third record in a row, but he declined to give a forecast figure.
Puma made a net profit of 49.4 million marks in 1995.

Earlier, Swedish investment group Proventus AB said it had sold half of its 12.5 percent stake in Puma to Hollywood independent film company Monarchy/Regency Enterprises, with an option to sell the rest of its holding.
